Did you know that the Sun produces energy by fusing hydrogen atoms together â€” the same process scientists are trying to replicate on Earth to create unlimited clean energy? This is nuclear fusion!

ðŸ’¡ The Simple Core

Nuclear fusion is the process of combining two light atomic nuclei (like hydrogen isotopes deuterium and tritium) to form a heavier nucleus, releasing enormous energy. This is the opposite of fission. Fusion releases even more energy per unit mass than fission, and produces no long-lived radioactive waste. The fuel (hydrogen isotopes) is found in seawater â€” nearly unlimited supply!

The Sun fuses about 620 million tonnes of hydrogen every second, converting about 4 million tonnes into pure energy (E=mcÂ²). The temperature required is over 15 million Â°C â€” hotter than anything on Earth. Scientists at ITER (International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor) in France are building the world's largest fusion reactor. India is a partner in ITER through its nuclear research programmes!
